intro: Lippia thymoides var. tonsilis, commonly known as Mexican thyme, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, small, gray-green leaves and clusters of white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for use in ornamental gardening and as a ground cover.
